content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is sitting in the canoe as Joey runs through the door carrying an outdoor patio table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!! We are so in luck! Treeger said that we could have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there. (Goes back into the hall)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, I’m, I’m paddling away!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh?!
content.parenthetical: Returning carrying a couple of rusted lawn chairs

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh. This and a bunch of bubble wrap. And, some of it is not even popped!
(They both sit down at the table and the chick and the duck enter from Joey’s bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could we be more white trash?

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How desperate am I?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Good thing Chandler’s not here, he always wins at this game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just told my Mom I’d cater a party for her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How come?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because I need the money, and I thought that it’d be a great way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, I think this is a good thing. I don’t think Mom would’ve hired you if she didn’t think you were good at what you do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t have to stick up for her. She can’t here you.

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is reading the paper and Chandler is getting ready for work.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just pickle.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the street yesterday.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My boss, Joanna? Wow, that must’ve been awkward.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a drink.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You ah, you didn’t say ‘Yes’ to that did you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Hello, Rachel. (She goes into Chandler’s bedroom)
content.parenthetical: Coming out of the shower wearing nothing but a towel

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, not at first.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is she doing here?
(Joey makes a sound like a creaking bed.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t understand! Last time you went out with her you said she was a ‘big, dull dud.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we were able to take the relationship to the next level.
(Joey creaks louder)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must end it now!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on! It’s not like this is an everyday occurrence for me! I mean usually I’m pretty much just in there by myself.
(Joey makes a sound imitating one person making a bed creak and Chandler turns and glares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!! (He turns around quickly) Promise me, you will end it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I promise, I’ll end it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hope you know what I’m giving up for ya, because she’s not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-eh-eah! (Rachel glares at him) Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what he meant.

content.description: [Scene: The Geller household kitchen, Monica and Phoebe are cooking for Mrs. Geller’s party.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: How’s the hired help?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Doing great, the quiches are coming along.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What’s this? Blue nail polish?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I thought it was cute.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ahh, that’s what your Grandmother’s hands looked like when we found her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let me ask you a question.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why did you hire me?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very nice, I assume you weren’t sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would be something. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because she thinks I’m good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I didn’t hear that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, she didn’t hire me out of pity, it wasn’t so she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks I’m good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! And hey, it’s cool if you’re a lesbian! (Gives her a thumbs up)

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is scrapping gum off the table as there is a knock on the door. He goes over and opens it.]

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Good afternoon, are you the decision maker of the house?
content.parenthetical: Entering before Joey can say anything

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhhh. (He’s not sure)

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopedias?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in there.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Actually, I’m not buying. I’m selling. Let me ask you one question. Do your friends ever have a conversation and you just nod along even though you’re not really sure what they’re talking about?
(We go into a flashback sequence with Joey remembering some of those times.)
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s apartment, all are there.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …I’m telling you it’s totally unconstituional.

content.speaker: Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, I totally agree.
(Joey just nods his head.)
[Cut to Central Perk, the entire gang is there.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …I think he deserves a Nobel Prize. (Joey starts to nod ‘Yes.’)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Nooo!! (Joey quickly stops nodding his head.)
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s, they’re all there playing cards.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …it was like the Algonquin kids table. (They all laugh, but Joey only laughs not to be left out.)
[Cut back to the present day.]

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry, you haven’t said anything for about two and a half minutes, are you at all interested?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-well-yeah! Yeah-oh-yeah. Come on in.

content.description: [Scene: The Geller’s Kitchen, Monica and Phoebe are still cooking.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s weird.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your nails.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I know, I never wear fake ones. I just did it so my Mom wouldn’t give me grief about me biting them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no, I meant that it’s weird that you only have nine now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. Wait a minute, I had them put… (realises) Oh my God! It’s in the quiche! Oh My God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, don’t panic. I’m gonna go to the store, I’m gonna get you another set of nails, no one’s gonna know, and you’re gonna look great. (She runs over to get her coat.) Oh! Oh, it’s ‘cause they’re gonna eat—that’s the problem.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: (to Monica) Honey, don’t bite your nails.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay ah, please don’t freak out. Umm, but ah, there’s a blue fingernail in one of the quiche cups, and there’s no way to know which one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And! Whoever finds it wins the prize!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’m not freaking out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then why are you laughing?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: It’s nothing, it’s just that now your Father owes me five dollars.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? You bet I’d lose a nail?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh no, don’t be silly. I just bet I’d need these. (Opens the freezer to reveal…)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Frozen lasagnas?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bet that I’d screw up?! So all that stuff about hiring me because I was good was…

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: No-no-no, that was all true. This was just in case you pulled a Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You promised Dr. Weinburg, you’d never use that phrase.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh honey, come on, have a sense of humour, you’ve never been able to laugh at yourself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. My Mom doesn’t have any faith in me! Oh, that’s hilarious! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t get it.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: No, I have faith…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! You have lasagnas! (Storms out and an awkward silence follows.)

content.speaker: Oven
content.text: Ding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Op, the ruined quiches are ready.

content.description: [Scene: Joanna’s office, Joanna and Chandler are making out on her chair. Chandler isn’t wearing any pants.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It just doesn’t…feel like we’re breaking up.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: No, we are. I’m sad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They start kissing again, but are interrupted by the phone.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Yes. (listens) Uh, can’t you wait until tomorrow? (listens) All right. (hangs up) Unbelievable!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: No, no, that was my boss. I have to go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Starts to button up his shirt)

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m getting dressed.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When I walk outside naked people throw garbage at me.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Wait. I wanna show you something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Just a little gag gift somebody gave me. (She’s holding a pair of handcuffs) Put your hands together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah-ha, you’re not the boss of me. (She kisses him) Yeah, you are! (She handcuffs him to the chair) Ooh, saucy.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I’ll be back in ten minutes. (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are, you’re gonna leave me like this?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Knowing you’re here, waiting for me I think it’s kinda exciting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. But if you don’t come back soon, (She leaves and closes the door) there’s pretty much nothing I can do about it!
[Cut to Joanna’s outer office, where Rachel and Sophie work. They are both coming back from lunch.]

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Hi! I brought you back a macaroon!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh great! I’ll keep it in my butt with your nose. (She grabs the cookie and walks out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s weird, she locked the door.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Y’know why? She’s got the Christmas bonus list in there. I saw her working on it this morning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, swear you won’t tell, but when Mark left he gave me a key to Joanna’s office. Do you wanna see the list?

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Yeah!
(Rachel unlocks and opens the door to reveal a half-naked Chandler handcuffed to the chair. They both gasp and Chandler stares at them in shock and surprise.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! (to Sophie) How are you?
(Rachel and Sophie both back out and close the door without saying anything.

content.description: [Scene: Joanna’s office, Chandler, still handcuffed to the chair, is looking through the lingerie catalogue by turning the pages with his teeth. The phone rings and Chandler answers it with his nose.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello, Joanna…(Realises he doesn’t know her last name)…’s office.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I’m really sorry but I may be a little while longer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How little?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: A couple of hours, I feel awful.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, this isn’t funny! You get back here right now!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I can’t!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I’m in my boss’s car!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Uh-oh, tunnel. (The phone gets cut off)
(Chandler gets an idea)
[Cut to Rachel’s office as her intercom buzzes.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: (angrily) What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel, could I see you for a moment?
(Rachel goes into talk to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here’s the situation. The keys to the cuffs are on the back of the door. Could you be a doll and grab them and scoot on over and unlock me? And on a totally different subject, that is a lovely pantsuit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You promised you would break up with her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did break up with her! She just took it really, really well!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And the fact that you were jeopardising my career never entered your mind?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It did enter my mind! But then something happened that made it, shoot right out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what Chandler, you got yourself into those cuffs, you get yourself out of them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no-no-no-no!! I can’t get myself right out of them! You must have me confused with the Amazing Chandler!! Come on, you have to unlock me, she could be gone for hours, and I’m cold, and (Stops and looks up the skirt on a statue behind Joanna’s desk.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Chandler!! All right, this is it! (Grabs the key) You never see Joanna again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Never!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You never come into this office again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You give me back my Walkman!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I—never borrowed your Walkman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then I lost it. You buy me one!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got it! Here we go! Come on! This is great! (Rachel goes over and unlocks the handcuffs) Ahhh! (He starts rubbing his wrist)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does it hurt?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I just always see guys doing this when they get handcuffs taken off them. (He runs over to where his pants are hanging) Hello sweet pants!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute! What are you gonna tell Joanna?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When she sees that you’re gone, she’s gonna know that I let you out, and that I was in here, and I’m gonna get fired!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll make something up! I’m good at lying, I actually did borrow your Walkman!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, there’s nothing to make up, she’s gonna know that I have a key to her office, I’ve got to get you locked up back the way you were! (She tries to drag him over to the chair, but Chandler stops her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho-ho, I don’t think so!

(He starts to put his pants on, but Rachel manages to drag him to the chair. When they get to the chair, Chandler drops his pants and knocks the chair away. Rachel then backs him up and locks him to the top drawer of a filing cabinet.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, this is much better.

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, The salesman is trying to sell Joey the encyclopedias.]

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: So, here’s somebody interesting, Joey. What do you know about Van Gogh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He cut off his ear.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m out.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: He painted that. (Points to one of his paintings in the book)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! That’s pretty nice. I thought he cut off his ear ‘cause he sucked. What else you got in there?

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Let’s see, ahhh… Where does the Pope live?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In the woods. No wait-wait, that’s the joke answer.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Actually its, Vatican City. Now ahh, what do you know about vulcanised rubber?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Spock’s birth control.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: You need these books.

content.description: [Scene: Monica’s childhood bedroom (which has been turned into a gym), Monica is lying on the treadmill as Phoebe enters.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This used to be your room? (She nods ‘Yes’) Wow! You must’ve been in really good shape as a kid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, I’m such an idiot. I can’t believe I actually thought she could change.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, who cares what your Mom thinks? So you pulled a Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good, I’m glad that’s catching on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No but, why does that have to be a bad thing. Just change what it means. Y’know? Go down there and prove your Mother wrong. Finish the job you were hired to do, and we’ll call that pulling a Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, umm, if a kid gets straight A’s, his parents would say, “Yeah, he pulled a Monica.” Y’know? Or a fireman saves a baby, and they go, “Yeah I know, he pulled a Monica.” Or someone hits a homerun and the announcer says, “Yeah, that one’s outta here.” Though some things don’t change.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ll go down there. But, I’m not gonna serve the lasagna. I’m gonna serve something I make.
(She exits and Phoebe goes over and sits down at the machine that works your shoulders and tries to do one, which she does, easily.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! My breasts are really strong. (She goes and joins Monica.)

content.description: [Scene: Joanna’s office, Rachel and Chandler are having a little tug-of-war with his pants.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler! Chandler, please, I have to get you locked up back the way you were, I am sooo gonna lose my job, she’s very private about her office. Now I know why.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, you’re in trouble either way! Okay? If she comes back and sees me locked to this instead of the chair, she’s gonna know you were in here. So you might as well just let me go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What if I clean your bathroom for a month?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It still wouldn’t be clean. (Rachel makes an ‘Eww, disgusting!’ face) All I want is my freedom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Foot rubs for a month!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Freedom!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll take all of your photos and put them into photo albums!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Freedom! I want my freedom! Why won’t you here me?! (Opens the door) Sophie, help me! Help me!! (Sophie stands up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sophie sit!!
(She closes the door and puts his tie into his mouth as a gag.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! God, would you just calm down!
(Chandler screams a little bit, then realises that he can spit out his gag. He does so with a ‘Pouff!’)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna say this for the last time. Would you please just… (He moves his arm which opens the drawer and hits in the back of the head, which proves his point.)

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is now reading the ‘V’ book, with the salesman watching.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! There’s a lot I didn’t know about vomit. (The duck comes to the door of the bathroom, quacking.) (To the duck) In a minute. (The duck goes back into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: So, what do you say, Joey? You get the whole set of encyclopedias for twelve hundred dollars, which works out to just 50 bucks a book!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Twelve hundred dollars? You think I have $1200? I’m home in the middle of the day, and I got patio furniture in my living room. I guess there’s a few things you don’t get from book learnin’.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Well ah, what can you swing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How about zero down and zero a month for a long, long time?

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: You don’t have, anything?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You wanna see what I got? (He gets up to empty out his pockets) Okay? I’ve got a baby Tootsie Roll, a movie stub, keys, a Kleenex, a rock, and an army man. Hey!

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Okay, I-I get the picture. Uh, thanks, for your time. (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And a 50. (The salesman stops suddenly) Huh, these must be Chandler’s pants.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: For 50 bucks, you can get one book! What will it be? A? B? C?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I-I think I’m gonna stick with the V, I wanna see how this bad boy turns out.

content.description: [Scene: Joanna’s office, Rachel and Chandler are still negotiating.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I ah, will buy and wrap all of your Christmas gifts.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I ah… Oh! I’ll squeeze you fresh orange juice every morning!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: With extra pulp?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: D’oh!! (pause) I’ve got it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t have it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have so got it. There’s gonna be rumours about this, there’s no way to stop it. Sophie knows, Monica and Phoebe know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do Monica and Phoebe know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I called them. And when they ask me what I saw, I can be very generous (Holds her hands far apart) or very (In a high pitched voice) stingy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Go on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can make you a legend. I can make you this generation’s Milton Berle.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And Milton Berle has a…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, not compared to you. (Chandler nods in agreement)

content.description: [Scene: The Geller’s kitchen, Phoebe is bringing in some dirty dishes.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They’re not even touching the lasagna!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, they love your casserole.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s hard to believe that just a little while ago this was nothing but ingredients.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, everyone seems to be enjoying your dish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And you?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I thought it was… quite tasty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So if everyone liked it, and you liked it, that would make this a success. Which would make you…

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: A bitch?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I was going for wrong, but we can use your word.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Yes, well I was wrong, and I have to say you really impressed me today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, you might even say that she pulled a Monica. (They both look at her) (to Monica) She doesn’t know we switched it. (Monica nods her head ‘No.’)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: And the next time you cater for me, there will be nothing but ice in the freezer. (She starts to bite her nails)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That really means a lot. Oh, and Mom, don’t bite your nails.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, all except Chandler, are there.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Joey, Rachel, and Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello, Chandler. (Phoebe has a huge smile on her face.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you. (Kisses her on the forehead)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wh-what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.
(She motions for them to come closer, they lean in and she whispers what Rachel told her. The guys both lean back laughing.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No he doesn’t!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two hours, that lasted!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So did you break up with Joanna?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it’s good thing you got out when you did, before she blew up like that Vesuvius.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The volcano?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. And speaking of volcanoes, man are they a violent igneous rock formation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, lava spewing, hot ash, of course some are dormant.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why are you talking about volcanoes all of the sudden?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we can talk about something else. What do you want to talk about? Vivisection? The Vasdeferens? The Vietnam War?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! Did anybody see that-that documentary on the Korean War? (Joey is pissed)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, Korea is such a beautiful country.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: With such a sad history.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could there be more Kims?
(They all laugh and Joey joins them, not to be left out. When the laughing dies down, he has a depressed look on his face.)

content.description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Rachel is coming in for the day.]

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Who’s out there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s me! Good morning!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Rachel, could you come in here for a moment, please?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure. Umm, they didn’t have poppy seed bagels, so I… (Enters Joanna’s office and sees her handcuffed to her chair wearing nothing but a slip) Oh my word!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I seem to have had a slight office mishap. Could you please get the key off the back of the door for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah! Yeah!
(She goes back and forth, not sure what to do first, put the bagel down or grab the key. She finally puts the bagel down and grabs the key and goes over to unlock Joanna.)

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: You tell your friend Chandler that we’re definately broken up this time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
